arabicText: إِن تُبْدُوا۟ ٱلصَّدَقَـٰتِ فَنِعِمَّا هِىَ ۖ وَإِن تُخْفُوهَا وَتُؤْتُوهَا ٱلْفُقَرَآءَ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَيُكَفِّرُ عَنكُم مِّن سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
If	 you	 give	 charity	 openly,	 what	 an	
excellent	 deed	 it	 is!	 And	 if	 you	 secretly	
give	it	 to	 the	 poor,	it	is	 the	 best	 for	 you;	
and	it	will	redeem	some	of	your	sins;	and	
Allah is	Aware	of	your	deeds
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	 khairāt	 do	 to	 woh	 kya	 hi	 achhi	 bāt	
hai	 aur	 agar	 chhupa	 kar	 faqeeron	 ko	 do	
yeh	 tumhāre	 liye	 sabse	 behtar	 hai	 aur	 is	
meiñ	tumhāre	kuchh	gunāh	ghateñ	ge	aur	
Allah	ko	tumhāre	kāmoñ	ki	khabar	hai	.

arabicText: ۞ لَّيْسَ عَلَيْكَ هُدَىٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ فَلِأَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُونَ إِلَّا ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ يُوَفَّ إِلَيْكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	 is	 not	 your	 duty	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	to	make	 them	accept	guidance	- but	
Allah guides	 whomever	 He	 wills;	 and	
whatever	 good	 thing	 you	 spend	 is	
beneficial	 for	 yourselves;	 and	 it	 is	 not	
right	 for	 you	 to	 spend	 except	 to	 seek	
Allah’s	pleasure;	and	whatever	you	spend	
will	be	 repaid	 to	 you	in	 full,	and	 you	will	
not	be	wronged.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unheiñ	 rāh	 dena	 tumhāre	 zimme	 lāzim	
nahi	hān	Allah	rāh	deta	hai	jise	chāhta	hai	
aur	 tum	 jo	 achhi	 chiz	 do	 to	 tumhāra	 hi	
bhala	 hai	 aur	 tumheiñ	 kharch	 Karna	
munāsib	 nahi	 magar	 Allah	 ki	 marzi	
chhahne	 ke	 liye	 aur	 jo	 māl do	 tumheiñ	
poora	milega	aur	nuqsān	na	diye jāo	ge

arabicText: لِلْفُقَرَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أُحْصِرُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ضَرْبًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَحْسَبُهُمُ ٱلْجَاهِلُ أَغْنِيَآءَ مِنَ ٱلتَّعَفُّفِ تَعْرِفُهُم بِسِيمَـٰهُمْ لَا يَسْـَٔلُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ إِلْحَافًۭا ۗ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِهِۦ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
(Spend)	 For	 the	 poor	 who	 are	 restricted	
while	in	Allah's	 cause,	who	 cannot	 travel	
in	 the	 land	 (for	 earning)	 - the	 unwise	
think	 they	 are	 wealthy	 because	 of	 their	
restraint;	you	will	recognise	them	by	their	
faces;	 they	 do	 not	 seek	 from	 people	 in	
order	to	avoid	grovelling;	and	Allah knows	whatever	you	spend	in	charity
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	 faqeeroñ	 ke	 liye	 jo	 rāh	 e	 khuda	 meiñ	
roke	gaye	 zameen	meiñ	 chal	 nahiñ	 sakte	 nadān	 unheiñ	 tawangar	 samjhe	 bachne	 ke	 sabab	 to	
unheiñ	 unki	 soorat	 se	 pahchān	 lega	 logoñ	 se	 suāl	 nahi	 karte	 ke	 gid-didāna	 pade	 aur	 tum	 jo	
khairāt	karo	Allah	usey	jānta	hai

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُم بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ سِرًّۭا وَعَلَانِيَةًۭ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	spend	their	wealth	by	night	and	day,	secretly	and	openly	- their	reward	is	with	their	
Lord;	and	there	shall	be	no	fear	upon	them	nor	shall	they	grieve.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	apne	māl	khairāt	karte	haiñ	rāt	meiñ	aur	din	meiñ	chupe	aur	zāhir	unke	liye	unka	neg	
(Ajr)	hai	unke	Rab	ke	pās	unko	na	kuchh	andesha	ho	na	kuchh	gham

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُم بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ سِرًّۭا وَعَلَانِيَةًۭ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأْكُلُونَ ٱلرِّبَوٰا۟ لَا يَقُومُونَ إِلَّا كَمَا يَقُومُ ٱلَّذِى يَتَخَبَّطُهُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ مِنَ ٱلْمَسِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا ٱلْبَيْعُ مِثْلُ ٱلرِّبَوٰا۟ ۗ وَأَحَلَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْبَيْعَ وَحَرَّمَ ٱلرِّبَوٰا۟ ۚ فَمَن جَآءَهُۥ مَوْعِظَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ فَٱنتَهَىٰ فَلَهُۥ مَا سَلَفَ وَأَمْرُهُۥٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَمَنْ عَادَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	devour	usury	will	not	stand	up	
on	 the	 Day	 of	 Judgement,	 except	 like	 the	
one	 whom	 an	 evil	 jinn	 has	 deranged	 by	
his	 touch;	 that	 is	 because	 they	 said,	
“Trade	is	also	like	usury!”;	whereas	Allah
has	 made	 trading	 lawful	 and	 forbidden	
usury;	 for	one	 to whom	 the	guidance	has	
come	 from	 his	 Lord,	 and	 he	 refrained	
therefrom,	is	lawful	what	he	has	 taken	in	
the	 past;	and	 his	affair	is	with	Allah;	and	
whoever	 continues	earning	it	 henceforth,	
is	of	the	people	of	fire;	they	will	remain	in	
it	for	ages
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Sood	khāte	haiñ	Qiyamat	ke	din	na	
khade	 hoñge	 Magar	 Jaise	 khada	 hota	 hai	
woh	jise	āseb	ne	choo	kar	makhboot	bana	
diya	ho	yeh	is	liye	ke	unhoñ	ne	kaha	bae'	
bhi	to	Sood	hi	ke	mānind	hai	aur	Allah	ne	
halāl	 kiya	 bae'ko	aur	 harām	 kiya	Sood	 to	
jise	 us	 ke	 Rab	 ke	 pās	 se	 nasihat	 āyi	 aur	
woh	bāz	raha	to	usey	halāl	hai	jo	pahle	le	
chuka	aur	us	ka	kām	khuda	ke	supurd	hai	
aur	 jo	 ab	 aisi	 harkat	 karega	 to	 woh	
dozakhi	hai	woh	us	meiñ	muddatoñ	raheñ	
ge

arabicText: يَمْحَقُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلرِّبَوٰا۟ وَيُرْبِى ٱلصَّدَقَـٰتِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ أَثِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
Allah destroys	 usury	 and	 increases	
charity;	 and	 Allah does	 not	 like	 any	
ungrateful,	excessive	sinner.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	halāk	karta	hai	Sood	ko	aur	badhāta	
hai	 khairāt	 ko	 aur	 Allah	 ko	 pasand	 nahi	
āata	koi	na-shukra	bada	gunehgār

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَوُا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 believed	 and	 did	 good	
deeds	 and	 kept	 the	 prayer	 established	
and	paid	the	charity	- their	reward	is	with	
their	Lord;	and	there	shall	be	no	fear	upon	
them	nor	shall	they	grieve.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Beshak	 woh	 jo	 Imān	 lāye	 aur	 achchhe	
kām	kiye	aur	namāz	qāyim	ki	aur	zakāt	di	
unka	neg (A’jr-o-Sawāb) unke	Rab	ke	pās	
hai	 aur	 na	 unheiñ	 kuchh	 andesha	 ho	 na	
kuchh	gham.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَذَرُوا۟ مَا بَقِىَ مِنَ ٱلرِّبَوٰٓا۟ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Fear	 Allah and	
forego	 the	 remaining	 usury,	 if	 you	 are	
Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo!	 Allah	 se	 daro	 aur	 chhod	
do	 jo	 bāqi	 reh	 gaya	 hai	 Sood	 agar	
Musalman	ho

arabicText: فَإِن لَّمْ تَفْعَلُوا۟ فَأْذَنُوا۟ بِحَرْبٍۢ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ۖ وَإِن تُبْتُمْ فَلَكُمْ رُءُوسُ أَمْوَٰلِكُمْ لَا تَظْلِمُونَ وَلَا تُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	do	not,	then	be	certain	of	a	war	
with	Allah and	His	Noble	Messenger;	and	
if	 you	 repent,	 take	 back	 your	 principal	
amount;	neither	you	cause	harm	to	someone,	nor	you	be	harmed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	agar	aisa	na	karo	to	yaqeen	karlo	Allah	aur	Allah	ke	Rasool	se	ladāi	ka	aur	agar	tum	tauba	
karo	to	apna	asl	māl	le	lo,	na	tum	kisi	ko	nuqsān	pahoñchao	na	tumheiñ	nuqsān	ho

arabicText: وَإِن كَانَ ذُو عُسْرَةٍۢ فَنَظِرَةٌ إِلَىٰ مَيْسَرَةٍۢ ۚ وَأَن تَصَدَّقُوا۟ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	if	 the	debtor	is	in	difficulty,	give	him	respite	 till	 the	 time	of	ease;	and	your	 foregoing	 the	
entire	debt	from	him	is	still	better	for	you,	if	only	you	realise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	qarz-dār	tangi	wāla	hai	to	usey	mohlat	do	āsani	tak	aur	qarz	us	par	bilkul	chhod	dena	
tumhāre	liye	aur	bhala	hai	agar	jāno

arabicText: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ يَوْمًۭا تُرْجَعُونَ فِيهِ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ ثُمَّ تُوَفَّىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	fear	the	day	in	which	you	will	be	returned	to	Allah;	and	every	soul	will	be	paid	back	in	full	
what	it	had	earned,	and	they	will	not	be	wronged.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	daro	us	din	se	jis	meiñ	Allah	ki	taraf	phiroge	aur	har	jān	ko	us	ki	kamāi	poori	bhar,	di	jāyegi	
aur	un	par	zulm na	hoga

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا تَدَايَنتُم بِدَيْنٍ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى فَٱكْتُبُوهُ ۚ وَلْيَكْتُب بَّيْنَكُمْ كَاتِبٌۢ بِٱلْعَدْلِ ۚ وَلَا يَأْبَ كَاتِبٌ أَن يَكْتُبَ كَمَا عَلَّمَهُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ فَلْيَكْتُبْ وَلْيُمْلِلِ ٱلَّذِى عَلَيْهِ ٱلْحَقُّ وَلْيَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّهُۥ وَلَا يَبْخَسْ مِنْهُ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ فَإِن كَانَ ٱلَّذِى عَلَيْهِ ٱلْحَقُّ سَفِيهًا أَوْ ضَعِيفًا أَوْ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ أَن يُمِلَّ هُوَ فَلْيُمْلِلْ وَلِيُّهُۥ بِٱلْعَدْلِ ۚ وَٱسْتَشْهِدُوا۟ شَهِيدَيْنِ مِن رِّجَالِكُمْ ۖ فَإِن لَّمْ يَكُونَا رَجُلَيْنِ فَرَجُلٌۭ وَٱمْرَأَتَانِ مِمَّن تَرْضَوْنَ مِنَ ٱلشُّهَدَآءِ أَن تَضِلَّ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا فَتُذَكِّرَ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا ٱلْأُخْرَىٰ ۚ وَلَا يَأْبَ ٱلشُّهَدَآءُ إِذَا مَا دُعُوا۟ ۚ وَلَا تَسْـَٔمُوٓا۟ أَن تَكْتُبُوهُ صَغِيرًا أَوْ كَبِيرًا إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلِهِۦ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ أَقْسَطُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَأَقْوَمُ لِلشَّهَـٰدَةِ وَأَدْنَىٰٓ أَلَّا تَرْتَابُوٓا۟ ۖ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَ تِجَـٰرَةً حَاضِرَةًۭ تُدِيرُونَهَا بَيْنَكُمْ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَلَّا تَكْتُبُوهَا ۗ وَأَشْهِدُوٓا۟ إِذَا تَبَايَعْتُمْ ۚ وَلَا يُضَآرَّ كَاتِبٌۭ وَلَا شَهِيدٌۭ ۚ وَإِن تَفْعَلُوا۟ فَإِنَّهُۥ فُسُوقٌۢ بِكُمْ ۗ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۖ وَيُعَلِّمُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 If	 you	 make	 an	
agreement	 for	 debt	 for	 a	 specified	 time,	
write	 it	 down;	 and	 appoint	 a	 scribe	 to	
write	 it	 for	 you	 with	 accuracy;	 and	 the	
scribe	 must	 not	 refuse	 to	 write	 in	 the	
manner	Allah has	 taught	him,	so	he	must	
write;	 and	 the	 liable	 person	 (debtor	 )	
should	 dictate	 it	 to	 him	 and	 fear	 Allah,	
Who	is	his	Lord,	and	not	hide	anything	of	
the	 truth;	 but	 if	 the	 debtor	 is	 of	 poor	
reasoning,	 or	 weak,	 or	 unable	 to	 dictate,	
then	 his	 guardian	 must	 dictate	 with	
justice;	 and	 appoint	 two	 witnesses	 from	
your	 men;	 then	 if	 two	 men	 are	 not	
available,	 one	man	and	 two	women	 from	
those	 you	 would	 prefer	 to	 be	 witnesses,	
so	 that	 if	 one	 of	 them	 forgets,	 the	 other	
can	 remind	 her;	 and	 the	 witnesses	 must	
not	refuse	when	called	upon	to	testify;	do	
not	feel	burdened	to	write	it,	whether	the	
transaction	is	small	or	big	- write	it	for	up	
to	 its	 term’s	 end;	 this	 is	 closer	 to	 justice	
before	Allah and	will	be	a	strong	evidence	
and	 more	 convenient	 to	 dispel	 doubts	
amongst	yourselves	- except	when	it	is	an	
instant	trade	in	which	exchange	is	carried	
out	immediately,	 there	is	no	sin	on	you	if	
it	is	not	written	down;	and	take	witnesses	
whenever	you	perform	trade;	and	neither	the	scribe	nor	the	witnesses	be	caused	any	harm	(or	
they	cause	any	harm);	and	if	 you	do,	it	would	be	an	offence	on	 your	part;	and	 fear	Allah;	and	
Allah teaches	you;	and	Allah knows	everything.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo!	 jab	 tum	 ek	 muqarrar	
muddat	 tak	 kisi	 dain	 ka	 len	 den	 karo	 to	
usey	 likh	 lo	 aur	 chāhiye	 ke	 tumhāre	
darmiyān	 koi	 likhne	 wāla	 theek	 theek	
likhe	 aur	 likhne	 wāla	 likhne	 se	 inkār	 na	
kare	jaisa	 ki	 usey	Allah	 ne	 sikhāya	 hai	 to	
usey	likh	dena	chāhiye	jis	par	haq	āta	hai	
woh	likhāta	jaye	aur	Allah	se	dare	jo	uska	
rab	 hai	 aur	 haq	 me	 se	 kuchh	 rakh	 na	
chhode	phir	jis	par	haq	āta	hai	agar	be	aql	
ya	 na-tawāñ	 ho	 ya	 likha	 na	 sake	 to	 uska	
wali	 insāf	 se	 likhāye	 aur	 do	 gawāh	 karlo	
apne	mardoñ	meiñ	 se	 phir	 agar	 do	mard	
na	 hoñ	 to	 ek	 mard	 aur	 do	 auratein,	 aise	
gawāh	 jin	 ko	 pasand	 karo	 ke	 kahiñ	
unmeiñ ek	 aurat	 bhoole	 to	 doosri	 yād	
dilāye	 aur	 gawāh	 jab	 bulāye	 to	 jāyeñ	 to	
āne	 se	 inkār	 na	 kareiñ	 aur	 isey	 bhāri	 na	
jāno	 ke	 dain	 chhota	 ho	 ya	 bada	 is	 ki	
mee'ād	tak	likhat	karlo	yeh	Allah	ke	nazdeek	ziyāda	insāf	ki	bāt	hai	aur	is	meiñ	gawāhi	khoob	
theek	rahegi	aur	yeh	is	se	qareeb	hai	ke	tumheiñ	shubah	na	pade	magar	yeh	ke koi	Sar-e-Dast	
ka	 sauda	dast	 badast	ho	 to	us	 ke	na	likhne	 ka	 tum	par	gunah	nahi	aur	jab	 khareed	 o	 farokht	
karo	to	gawah	karlo	aur	na	kisi	likhne	wāle	ko	zarar	diya	jāye	na	gawah	ko	(ya	na	likhne	wāla	
zarar	 de	 na	 gawah)	 aur	 jo	 aisa	 karo	 to	 yeh	 tumhāra	 fisq hoga	 aur	 Allah	 se	 daro	 aur	 Allah	
tumheiñ	sikhata	hai	aur	Allah	sab	kuchh	jānta	hai

arabicText: ۞ وَإِن كُنتُمْ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٍۢ وَلَمْ تَجِدُوا۟ كَاتِبًۭا فَرِهَـٰنٌۭ مَّقْبُوضَةٌۭ ۖ فَإِنْ أَمِنَ بَعْضُكُم بَعْضًۭا فَلْيُؤَدِّ ٱلَّذِى ٱؤْتُمِنَ أَمَـٰنَتَهُۥ وَلْيَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّهُۥ ۗ وَلَا تَكْتُمُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَـٰدَةَ ۚ وَمَن يَكْتُمْهَا فَإِنَّهُۥٓ ءَاثِمٌۭ قَلْبُهُۥ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	 you	 are	 on	 a	 journey	 and	 cannot	
find	 a	 scribe,	 then	 a	 mortgage	 (deposit)	
must	 be	 handed	 over;	 and	 if	 one	 of	 you	
trusts	 the	 other,	 the	 one	 who	 is	 trusted	
may	 return	 the	 mortgage	 entrusted	 to	
him	 and	 fear	Allah,	 his	 Lord;	 and	 do	 not	
hide	 testimony;	 and	 if	 one	 hides	 it,	 his	
heart	 is	 sinful	 from	 within;	 and	 Allah
knows	what	you	do
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 tum	 safar	 mein	 ho	 aur	 likhne	
wāla	 na	 pāo	 to	 girav ho	 qabze	meiñ	 diya	
hua	 aur	 agar	 tum	meiñ	 ek	 ko	 doosre	 par	
itminān	 ho	 to	 woh	 jise	 us	 ne	 ameen	
samajha	 tha	 apni	 amanat	 ada	 kare	 aur	
Allah	se	daro	jo	us	ka	rab	hai.	aur	gawāhi	
na	 chupao	 aur	 jo	 gawāhi	 chupāye	 ga	 to	
andar	se	us	ka	dil	gunehgār	hai	aur	Allah	
tumhāre	kāmoñ	ko	jānta	hai

arabicText: لِّلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَإِن تُبْدُوا۟ مَا فِىٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَوْ تُخْفُوهُ يُحَاسِبْكُم بِهِ ٱللَّهُ ۖ فَيَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
To	 Allah only	 belongs	 all	 whatever	 is	 in	
the	 heavens	 and	 all	 whatever	 is	 in	 the	
earth;	and	whether	you	disclose	what	is	in	
your	 hearts	 or	 hide	 it,	 Allah will	 take	
account	of	it	 from	you;	so	He	will	 forgive	
whomever	He	wills	and	punish	whomever	
He	wills;	and	Allah is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	hi	ka	hai	jo	kuch	āsmanoñ	meiñ	hai	
aur	jo	kuch	zameen	meiñ	hai	aur	agar tum
zāhir	karo	jo	kuch	tumhāre	ji	meiñ	hai	ya	
chupao	 Allah	 tum	 se	 us	 ka	 hisāb	 lega	 to	
jise	 chāhe	 ga bakshe	 ga	 aur	 jise	 chahega
saza	 dega	 aur	 Allah	 har	 cheez	 par	 Qadir	
hai

arabicText: ءَامَنَ ٱلرَّسُولُ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مِن رَّبِّهِۦ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۚ كُلٌّ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَمَلَـٰٓئِكَتِهِۦ وَكُتُبِهِۦ وَرُسُلِهِۦ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍۢ مِّن رُّسُلِهِۦ ۚ وَقَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۖ غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَإِلَيْكَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
The	Noble	Messenger	believes	in	what	has	
been	sent	down	to	him	by	his	Lord,	and	so	
do	the	believers;	all	have	accepted	faith	in	
Allah and	 His	 angels	 and	 His	 Books	 and	
His	Noble	Messengers;	saying,	“We	do	not	
make	 any distinction,	 in	 believing,	
between	 any	 of	 His	 Noble	 Messengers”;	
and	 they	 said,	 “We	 hear,	 and	 we	 obey;	
Your	 forgiveness	 be	 granted,	O	 our	 Lord,	
and	towards	You	is	our	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rasool	 Imān	 lāya	 us	 par	 jo	 us	 ke	 rab	 ke	
pās	 se	 us	 par	 utra	 aur	 Imān	 wale	 sabne	
māna	 Allah	 aur	 uske	 Farishton	 aur	 uski	
Kitabon	 aur	 uske	 Rasooloñ	 ko	 ye	 kahte	
huye	 ki,	 ham	 uske	 kisi	 Rasool	 par	 iman	
lāne	me	farq	nahi	karte	hain	aur	arz ki	ke	
ham	ne	Suna	aur	māna	teri	mu'āfi		ho	aye	
Rab	hamare!	aur	teri	hi	taraf	phirna	hai,

arabicText: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا ٱكْتَسَبَتْ ۗ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَآ إِصْرًۭا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَٱعْفُ عَنَّا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah does	 not	 burden	 any	 soul,	 except	
with	something	within	its	capacity;	beneficial	for	it	is	the	virtue	it	earned,	and	harmful	for	it	is	
the	evil	it	earned;	“Our	Lord!	Do	not	seize	us	if	we	forget	or	are	mistaken;	our	Lord!	And	do	not	
place	on	us	a	heavy	burden	(responsibility)	as	You	did	on	those	before	us;	our	Lord!	And	do	not	
impose	on	us	a	burden,	for	which	we	do	not	have	the	strength;	and	pardon	us	- and	forgive	us	-
and	have	mercy	on	us	- You	are	our	Master,	therefore	help	us	against	the	disbelievers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	kisi	jān	par	bojh	nahi	dālta	magar	us	ki	tāqat	bhar	us	ka	fāyeda	hai	jo	achcha	kamāya	aur	
us	 ka	 nuqsān	 hai	 jo	 burāi	 kamāi	 aey	 Rab	 hamāre!	 hameiñ	 na	 pakad	magar hum	 bhooleiñ	 ya	
chookeiñ	aey	Rab	hamāre!	Aur	ham	par	bhāri	bojh	na	rakh	jaisa	tu	ne	hum	se	agloñ	par	rakha	
tha	aey	Rab	hamāre!	Aur	ham	par	woh	bojh	na	dāl	jis	ki	hameiñ	sahār (Tāqat) na	ho	aur	hameiñ	
mu'āf	farma	de	aur	bakhsh	de	aur	hum	par	mehar	(Rahem)	kar	tu	hamāra	maula	hai	tu	kāfiroñ	
par	hameiñ	madad	de.

arabicText: مُالٓمٓ
englishTranslationText: Alif-Laam-Meem.
romanUrduTranslationText: Alif-laam-meem

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ
englishTranslationText: Allah - none is worthy of worship, except Him, He is Alive (eternally, on His own) and the Upholder (keeps others established).
romanUrduTranslationText: Allah hai jis ke siwa kisi ki pooja nahi āap zinda auroñ ka qāim rakhne wāla.

arabicText: مِنَزَّلَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًۭا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ وَٱلْإِنجِيلَ
englishTranslationText: He has sent down to you (O dear Prophet Muhammad - peace and blessings be upon him) this true Book (the Holy Qur’an), confirming the Books before it, and He sent down the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Bible).
romanUrduTranslationText: Us ne tum par ye sachchi Kitāb utāri agli Kitāboñ ki tasdeeq farmāti aur us ne is se pehle Tauret aur Injeel utāri.

arabicText: مِن قَبْلُ هُدًۭى لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ شَدِيدٌۭ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌۭ ذُو ٱنتِقَامٍ
englishTranslationText:
Before	 this,	 a	 guidance	 to	 mankind;	 and	 sent	
down	the	Judgement	(Criterion	to	judge	between	
right	 and	 wrong);	 indeed	 for	 those	 who	
disbelieved	 in	 the	 verses	 of	 Allah,	 is	 a	 severe	
punishment;	 and	 Allah is	 the	 Almighty,	 the	
Avenger	(of	the	wrong).
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Logoñ	 ko	 rāh	 dikhāti	 aur	 faisla	 utāra,	
beshak	woh	jo	Allah	ki	āayatoñ	se	munkir	
huwe	un	ke	liye	sakht	‘azāb	hai	aur	Allah	
ghalib	badla	lene	wāla	hai,
